solution_line_template: From Monday to Wednesday, there are {days_mon_wed} * {hours_per_day} = <<{days_mon_wed}*{hours_per_day}={hours_mon_wed}>>{hours_mon_wed} hours of work.
During this time the driver drove {hours_mon_wed} * {speed_mon_wed} = <<{hours_mon_wed}*{speed_mon_wed}={distance_mon_wed}>>{distance_mon_wed} kilometers.
On Thursday and Friday, there are {days_thu_fri} * {hours_per_day} = <<{days_thu_fri}*{hours_per_day}={hours_thu_fri}>>{hours_thu_fri} hours of work in total.
During this time the driver drove {hours_thu_fri} * {speed_thu_fri} = <<{hours_thu_fri}*{speed_thu_fri}={distance_thu_fri}>>{distance_thu_fri} kilometers.
So in total, the driver traveled {distance_mon_wed} + {distance_thu_fri} = <<{distance_mon_wed}+{distance_thu_fri}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers during these five days.
